Sure, here are some culinary tours to do in Mexico City:

1. Street Food Tour: Experience the vibrant street food scene of Mexico City with a guided tour through the city's food stalls, markets and food trucks. Taste traditional Mexican dishes such as tacos, tortas and tamales made with authentic ingredients.

2. Mercado San Juan Tour: Explore one of Mexico City's most famous markets, known for its exotic meats and local produce. Learn how to select the best ingredients and enjoy a cooking class where you'll make your own traditional Mexican dish.

3. Mezcal and Tequila Tasting Tour: Discover the fascinating world of mezcal and tequila with a guided tasting tour through some of Mexico City's best mezcalerias and tequila bars. Learn about the different types of agave plants and the production process for these iconic Mexican spirits.

4. Historic Center Food Tour: Take a walking tour through the heart of Mexico City's historic center, stopping at taquerias, cantinas and street food carts to sample local specialties such as enchiladas, churros, and pozole.

5. Pujol Restaurant Tour: Indulge in a fine dining experience at Pujol, one of Mexico City's most renowned restaurants, known for its modern interpretation of traditional Mexican cuisine. Enjoy a multi-course tasting menu featuring dishes made with locally sourced ingredients.
